abstract: Lawyer representing family of Zachary Hammond, white 19-year-old who was fatally shot by Lt Mark Tiller of Seneca, SC, police, says death has received relatively less attention than unarmed shooting deaths of black men because Hammond was white; other factors such as lack of police dash cam video could also be responsible for relative lack of media coverage.
lead_paragraph: Supporters of Zachary Hammond, a 19-year-old who was killed last month by the Seneca, S.C., police, say he would have received more attention had he been black. But race was only one factor.

headline.main: Without Release of Video, Police Shooting of White Driver Gets Less Publicity
headline.print_headline: Without Release of Video, Police Shooting of White Driver Gets Less Publicity

snippet: Supporters of Zachary Hammond, a 19-year-old who was killed last month by the Seneca, S.C., police, say he would have received more attention had he been black. But race was only one factor.
